Literature Review: The discovery of interstellar interlopers has opened a new window into the vast and unexplored galactic population. The first two identified interlopers, 1I/‘Oumuamua and 2I/Borisov, have exhibited unexpectedly different physical properties, challenging our current understanding of their formation and evolution. This literature review aims to summarize the current state of knowledge on interstellar interlopers, their properties, and their potential origins.

The Orbital Evolution of 2I/Borisov: A Study of its Comet-like Properties
The Formation of Interstellar Interlopers: A Study of their Protoplanetary Disk Origins
The Physical Properties of 1I/‘Oumuamua: A Study of its Asteroid-like Characteristics
The Interstellar Interlopers: A New Window into the Galactic Population
The Number Density of Interstellar Interlopers: A Study of their Galactic Distribution
The Formation of Interstellar Interlopers: A Study of their Protostellar Origins
The Interstellar Interlopers: A New Frontier in Astrophysics
